## Task: LLM-as-Judge Workflow

title: WebSocket State Sync: Conflict resolution implementation
description:
Implement the conflict resolution strategy for WebSocket state sync as specified in PRD §9.4.

PRD Reference: §9.4 WebSocket State Sync Protocol & Conflict Resolution

Protocol Requirements:
- Message format: type, sequence, timestamp, patch (JSON Patch), checksum
- Client applies patch only if sequence = last_sequence + 1
- Gap detected → client requests full state sync
- Optimistic updates: client applies locally, reverts on server rejection

Conflict Resolution (PRD §9.4):
1. Server is authoritative
2. Client applies patch only if sequence = last_sequence + 1
3. Gap detected → client requests full state sync
4. Optimistic updates: client applies locally, reverts on server rejection

Acceptance Criteria:
- Sequence number enforcement works
- Gap detection triggers full sync request
- Server rejection reverts optimistic updates
- Checksum validation detects corruption
- Tests cover all conflict scenarios
acceptance_criteria: Sequence enforcement. Gap recovery. Optimistic updates with rollback. Checksum validation.

title: F1.4: WebSocket Transport Layer (EI-003: AG-UI Protocol)
description:
WebSocket Transport Layer (§9.4 of PRD)

Implements AG-UI protocol over WebSocket with heartbeat, reconnection, state sync, and idempotency.

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN WebSocket connection WHEN established THEN heartbeat pings every 30s
GIVEN connection drops WHEN client reconnects THEN exponential backoff (1s base, max 30s, max 10 attempts)
GIVEN state update WHEN received THEN sequence number validated and checksum verified
GIVEN duplicate event WHEN received THEN client discards idempotently
GIVEN connection gap WHEN detected THEN client requests full state sync

title: Intent Index: pgvector schema & embedding model setup
description:
Implement the Intent Index using PostgreSQL with pgvector extension as specified in PRD §15.2.

PRD Reference: §15.2 Intent Index Implementation

Technical Specs:
- Storage: PostgreSQL with pgvector extension
- Embedding Model: sentence-transformers/all-MiniLM-L6-v2 (384 dimensions)
- Schema: id (UUID), user_id (UUID FK), intent_text (TEXT), embedding (VECTOR(384)), resolution (JSONB), outcome (ENUM), created_at (TIMESTAMP)

Query Algorithm (PRD §15.2):
1. Embed incoming input with same model
2. Cosine similarity: SELECT * WHERE 1 - (embedding <=> query) > 0.7
3. Rank by similarity * recency_weight (decay: 0.99^days_old)
4. Return top 5 matches

Update Strategy:
- Insert on assumption approval
- Update outcome on action completion
- Prune entries older than 90 days with outcome='failure'

Acceptance Criteria:
- pgvector extension installed and configured
- Embedding model integrated
- Schema matches PRD exactly
- Query algorithm implements decay formula
- Pruning job runs periodically
acceptance_criteria: pgvector + embedding model working. Schema correct. Query with decay. Pruning implemented.

title: Gateway Import Check: Automated scan for direct provider imports

grep -r 'import.*openai\|import.*anthropic\|from.*openai\|from.*anthropic' intentuimvp/backend/app/ --exclude-dir=gateway

Expected Result: Zero matches (except in gateway/client.py)

Implementation:
- Add to CI pipeline as required check
- Script exits with error code 1 if any matches found
- Error message shows file path and line number
- Exclude gateway/client.py (the ONLY module allowed to import providers)
- Run on pre-commit hook locally

Acceptance Criteria:
- CI check runs on every commit
- Violations block PR merge
- Clear error message guides developer to use GatewayClient
- Pre-commit hook catches violations locally
- Zero false positives from legitimate gateway/ code
acceptance_criteria: CI check blocks direct imports. Pre-commit hook works. Zero false positives.

title: E3: AG-UI Core Loop
description: The command → assumptions → execution loop with HITL. This is the primary interaction pattern. PRD References: FR-006, FR-007, FR-008, FR-009, FR-010. Target: Milestone A
acceptance_criteria: Context routing with 3-priority algorithm. Intent deciphering with confidence thresholds (0.95 auto, 0.70-0.94 show). Assumptions panel for HITL reconciliation. AG-UI run lifecycle with streaming. Canvas action tools for agents.

title: T1-F3.1: Implement routing algorithm
description:
Implement routing algorithm per FR-006 (§11 of PRD)

3-priority routing strategy:
1. Exact command match (slash commands like /research, /calendar)
2. Intent classification via LLM (Gateway structured output)
3. Keyword fallback (regex patterns)

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN context submitted WHEN routed THEN dispatch within 500ms
GIVEN multiple handlers match WHEN same priority THEN highest confidence wins
GIVEN tie in priority and confidence WHEN routing THEN prompt user for disambiguation
GIVEN 3 consecutive failures WHEN circuit breaker trips THEN fallback handler for 30s
GIVEN timeout occurs WHEN >500ms elapsed THEN fallback to keyword routing

title: T1-F3.3: Backend: Assumption endpoint
description:
Backend: Assumption endpoint per FR-008 (§11 of PRD)

Create REST endpoint to return structured assumptions for HITL confirmation.

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN assumptions generated WHEN endpoint called THEN returns JSON with intent, confidence, alternatives
GIVEN user approves WHEN endpoint receives confirmation THEN assumption stored for learning
GIVEN user rejects WHEN endpoint receives rejection THEN assumption discarded and feedback captured
GIVEN endpoint fails WHEN error occurs THEN returns 500 with correlation ID for tracing

title: T4-F3.4: Frontend: State delta application
description: Apply AG-UI state.delta patches on the frontend with sequence validation and gap recovery.
acceptance_criteria: Given sequential state.delta events, when applied, then state updates in order without duplication.\nGiven a duplicate event, when applied, then state remains idempotent.\nGiven a sequence gap, when detected, then a full state sync is requested before applying further deltas.

title: T1-F3.5: Implement create_node tool
description: Implement backend tool canvas.create_node(type, content, position, metadata) to create a node and persist it to the workspace graph.
acceptance_criteria: Given a valid payload, when canvas.create_node is called, then a node is persisted with type, content, position, and metadata and the node id is returned.\nGiven missing/invalid fields, when called, then validation fails and no node is created.\nGiven metadata is provided, when called, then metadata is stored and retrievable.

title: T2-F3.5: Implement update_node tool
description: Implement backend tool canvas.update_node(node_id, patch) to update node fields (label/content/position/metadata) with partial updates.
acceptance_criteria: Given an existing node and patch, when canvas.update_node is called, then the node is updated and persisted.\nGiven a nonexistent node id, when called, then a not-found error is returned.\nGiven a partial patch, when called, then unspecified fields remain unchanged.

title: T3-F3.5: Implement link_nodes tool
description: Implement backend tool canvas.link_nodes(from_id, to_id, relation_type, metadata) to create typed edges between nodes.
acceptance_criteria: Given valid node ids and relation_type, when canvas.link_nodes is called, then an edge is created and persisted with type/label/metadata.\nGiven an invalid node id or relation_type, when called, then validation fails and no edge is created.\nCreated edges are returned via edge queries for both nodes.

title: T4-F3.5: Implement spawn_job tool
description: Implement backend tool canvas.spawn_job(job_type, input_refs, params) to enqueue async jobs and return job_id.
acceptance_criteria: Given a valid job_type and inputs, when canvas.spawn_job is called, then a job is created in queued state and a job_id is returned.\nJob inputs and params are persisted for later retrieval.\nGiven an invalid job_type, when called, then an error is returned and no job is created.

title: T5-F3.5: Implement hitl.request_approval tool
description: Implement backend tool hitl.request_approval(assumption_set) to register a HITL request and block until a decision is made.
acceptance_criteria: Given an assumption set, when hitl.request_approval is called, then a HITL request is recorded and the UI is notified.\nWhen the user approves/rejects/edits, the tool returns the decision payload.\nDecisions are stored for future learning/analysis.

acceptance_criteria: Given a query and scope, when workspace.search is called, then matching nodes/documents are returned limited to the scope.\nGiven no matches, when called, then an empty list is returned.\nScope values selection/canvas/all are honored.

- Time-to-Value (target <30s): Time from command to useful output (simple tasks)
- Session Continuity (target >60%): % of users resuming previous workspace vs. starting fresh
- Research Job Completion (target >75%): % of deep research jobs completing successfully

- MCP Adoption (target >30%): % of users with at least one MCP configured

title: T1-F2.1: Backend: Canvas load endpoint
description:
Backend: Canvas load endpoint per FR-001 (§11 of PRD)

Create REST endpoint to load canvas state including nodes, documents, positions, and edges.

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN user session exists WHEN endpoint called THEN returns canvas state within 2 seconds
GIVEN previous state exists WHEN loaded THEN all nodes, documents, positions restored
GIVEN corrupted state WHEN detected THEN return fallback blank canvas with error logged
GIVEN no state exists WHEN first-time user THEN return blank canvas template

title: T1-F2.5: Frontend: Floating command box
description: Implement floating command input box on the canvas (focusable via shortcut).
acceptance_criteria: Given the canvas is loaded, when the workspace renders, then the command box is visible.\nKeyboard shortcut focuses the input.\nSubmitting a command emits the text payload for routing.

title: T2-F2.5: Frontend: Slash templates
description: Implement slash command templates for /research, /judge, /plan, /dashboard, /graph, /export.
acceptance_criteria: Typing '/' shows templates.\nSelecting a template inserts the correct command stub.\nSubmitting a template triggers the corresponding command type.

title: T3-F2.5: Backend: Command submission endpoint
description: Create backend endpoint to accept command submissions (text, selection scope, attachments) and dispatch to the routing pipeline.
acceptance_criteria: Given a valid command payload, when submitted, then the endpoint returns a correlation id and enqueues routing.\nGiven a missing command, when submitted, then 400 is returned with validation error.\nCommand dispatch happens within the 500ms budget for routing handoff.

title: F1.7: Accessibility Compliance (NFR-A11Y)
description: Implement accessibility requirements per NFR-A11Y-001 to NFR-A11Y-004: keyboard navigation, screen reader support, color contrast (WCAG 2.1 AA), focus management.
acceptance_criteria: All primary actions accessible via keyboard. Semantic HTML with ARIA labels. WCAG 2.1 AA color contrast. Visible focus indicators.

title: T1-F1.7: Implement keyboard navigation
description: Ensure all primary actions are accessible via keyboard per NFR-A11Y-001.
acceptance_criteria: Canvas pan/zoom works with keyboard. Node selection/editing via keyboard. Command box accessible via shortcut. Tab navigation works correctly.

title: T2-F1.7: Add ARIA labels and screen reader support
description: Add semantic HTML and ARIA labels for screen reader support per NFR-A11Y-002.
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements have ARIA labels. Canvas elements announced properly. Live regions for status updates.

title: T3-F1.7: Ensure WCAG 2.1 AA color contrast
description: Verify and fix color contrast to meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards per NFR-A11Y-003.
acceptance_criteria: All text meets 4.5:1 contrast ratio. UI elements meet 3:1 contrast ratio. Automated contrast checking in CI.

title: T4-F1.7: Implement visible focus indicators
description: Add visible focus indicators per NFR-A11Y-004.
acceptance_criteria: All focusable elements have visible focus state. Focus order is logical. No focus traps.

title: T2-F2.1: Frontend: Canvas renders on load
T3-F2.2: Frontend: Node drag & drop
description: Implement node drag-and-drop on the canvas with live position updates.
acceptance_criteria: Given a node, when dragged, then the node follows the cursor and the final drop updates position state.\nOn drop, the new position is persisted via update call.\nDragging does not break selection state.

title: F9.4: Maintainability & DDD Discipline (NFR-MAINT)
description: Define DDD boundaries and maintainability practices (NFR-MAINT, EI-005).
acceptance_criteria: Bounded contexts documented and module docs/test coverage targets established.

title: Domain Invariants Validation (§14)
description:
Validate that all domain invariants from PRD §14 are enforced in the codebase.

PRD Reference: §14 Domain Invariants & Business Rules

Domain Invariants to validate:
- CI-001: Node position must be unique within Canvas → CanvasAggregate validates
- CI-002: Node's linkedDocumentId must reference Document in same Canvas → Aggregate validation
- SI-001: Assumption must be resolved before executing dependent actions → Agent Context checks
- JI-001: Only one deep_research Job per topic simultaneously → JobService checks duplicates
- JI-002: Job cannot transition from completed/failed to running → State machine validation
- MI-001: MCPServer must pass security validation before activation → MCPServerAggregate
- TI-001: TaskDAG must be acyclic (topological sort validation on dependency addition)
- TI-002: CalendarSync requires active MCP connection → MCPManager validation

Acceptance Criteria:
GIVEN each invariant WHEN code implements enforcement THEN:
- Validation logic exists in appropriate aggregate/service
- Tests cover violation scenarios
- Error messages reference invariant ID
- Documentation links to PRD §14
acceptance_criteria: All 8 domain invariants have enforcement code, tests, and docs.

title: EI-003 Validation: AG-UI Protocol Compliance
description:
Validate that the AG-UI protocol implementation complies with the specification.

PRD Reference: §3 EI-003 - AG-UI Protocol

Current Protocol Version: 1.0.0

Validation Points:
- WebSocket-based AG-UI with JSON message envelopes
- Message format includes: version, messageId, timestamp, source/target, correlationId
- Event types implemented: run.start, run.end, tool.call, tool.result, state.snapshot, state.delta, progress
- RunAgentInput format: minimal messages + shared state snapshot + tools
- Event ordering is correct
- State updates are idempotent
- Reconnect can resume via REST query

Acceptance Criteria:
- GIVEN AG-UI messages WHEN sent THEN they conform to AG-UI v1.0.0 spec
- GIVEN events stream WHEN received THEN ordering and idempotency guarantees hold
- Integration tests validate spec compliance
acceptance_criteria: AG-UI v1.0.0 spec compliance validated. Message format correct. Event handling robust.

title: E5: Planning & Visualization
description: Planner generates plans and DAGs; graphs are editable and can sync to Calendar. PRD References: FR-013, FR-014, FR-015. Target: Milestone D
acceptance_criteria: PlannerAgent creates plan + DAG nodes. Graph/plan/DAG editing with annotations and cycle detection. Dashboard nodes subscribe to state/tool outputs with live refresh.

title: T3-F5.1: Create plan node + DAG node
T1-F9.2: Gateway retry/backoff policy
description: Define and implement retry/backoff behavior for Gateway dependency failures (NFR-REL-001).
acceptance_criteria: Gateway calls retry with exponential backoff and clear max attempts.\nOn exhaustion, user-facing degradation is triggered and logged.
